metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15906 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does notproperly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackersto create zero-length files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssh package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4').
